page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY IN KNOYDART
page.content: THE AREA WAS WELL INHABITED UNTIL THE KNOYDART CLEARANCE IN 1854,WHEN THE AREA WAS FORCEABLY CLEARED OF PEOPLE THAT IT MIGHT BE SOLD TO RUN SHEEP. THE AREA IS DOTTED WITH SITES OF FORMER HABITATION-MARKED BY A NEARBY STREAM,ROWAN TREE,FOUNDATION STONES AND LAZYBEDS. {MONUMENTS }THERE ARE 2 OF THESE OF RECENT ORIGIN {BROCKETS MONUMENT } BUILT IN 1937 BY THE BROCKET FAMILY TO MARK THEIR OWNERSHIP.{THE MADONNA } ERECTED BY SIR O.CROSTHWAITHE-EYRE IN 1946 IT STANDS OVERLOOKING THE BAY. {INVERIE}IS THE MAIN SETTLEMENT IT BECAME THIS AFTER 1860. {KNOYDART }THE NAME OF THE AREA AS A WHOLE IS KNOYDART.IT IS OFTEN REFERRED TO AS "THE ROUGH BOUNDS OF KNOYDART".THE DEREVATION IS KNUT'S BAY A REFERENCE TO THE USE OF THE BAY FOR SHELTER DURING THE VIKING RAIDS.
